FuncDef: This command defines explicit channels or channel ranges that are associated with the containing bundle. A channel or channel range is defined by their destination IP addresses. A channel may be defined using either IPv4 or IPv6 addresses. If a channel range is being defined, both the start and ending addresses must be the same type.

ParaDef.Info: The start-channel-ip-address parameter and optional end-channel-ip-address parameters define the starting and ending destination IP addresses for a channel range. Values-Any valid IP multicast destination address. ParamDefault: Default- None

The create keyword is required if creating a new multicast channel range when the system is configured to require the explicit use of the keyword to prevent accidental object creation. Objects may be accidentally created when this protection is disabled and an object name is mistyped when attempting to edit the object. This keyword is not required when the protection is disabled. The keyword is ignored when the specified channel range already exists.
